result.execSummary:
The defendant Bernard T Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
*25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

*Maintain absolute sobriety 
*Fill all prescriptions and controlled substances at one pharmacy
*Sign all releases of information 
*Complete Domestic Abuse Alternative Program 
*Comply with other counseling as recommended by the Agent
*No contact with April Wingo unless allowed by CHIPS order or DHHS and/or DOC.
*Any communication with April Wingo must be approved by DOC and/or DHHS.
*AODA Assessment & comply with treatment recommendations.  Follow any aftercare program.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Bernard T. Gordon in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Bernard T. Gordon in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:58 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea today.

There is an agreement.
State has submitted an amended information, amending Count 1.

Defendant will plead to Count 1 and Count 2. 
Count 3 will be dismissed and read in.

Atty Wallace concurs.

Atty Wallace has received a copy of the amended information, waives reading.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1 - amended
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 2

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Wallace for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Contrary to the statute section stated therein - amended
Count 2: Contrary to the statute section stated therein
Count 3: Dismissed and read in

Victim was given notification. There is no victim present.

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Wallace makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Prison Sentence for 19 Months
Initial Confinement for 13 Months
Extended Supervision for 6 Months
24 Days Credit
Concurrent to all other sentences
Not eligible for challenge incarceration
Not eligible for earned release
Conditions:
No Contact with April Wingo unless allowed by CHIPS order or DHHS and/or DOC 
Any communication with April Wingo must be approved by DOC and/or DHHS
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
AODA assessment and comply with all  treatment recommendations. Follow any aftercare program.
Maintain absolute sobriety 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia
Do not associate with anyone possessing or consuming controlled substances
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription
Fill all prescriptions and controlled substances at one pharmacy
Sign necessary releases of information
Complete Domestice Abuse Alternative Program
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent

Count 2:
Prison Sentence for 37 Months
Initial Confinement for 13 Months
Extended Supervision for 24 Months
24 Days Credit
Concurrent to Count 1 and Concurrent to all other sentences
Not eligible for challenge incarceration
Not eligible for earned release
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 1
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge

20 days in which to appeal

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing at 01-27-2016 11:00 am
Pre-trial conference at 01-25-2016 11:00 am

Defendant Bernard T. Gordon in court, in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Wallace appears via telephone.

11:27 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.
Court questions the defendant as to why there was a motion for his attorney to withdraw.
Defendant makes statements.
Court questions Atty Constable if Atty Wallace was to appear today; Atty Constable indicates that he was to be calling in at 11:30 a.m.
Defendant would like Attorney Wallace to remain on his case.
11:30 a.m.  Clerk places a call to Atty Wallace.
Court questions Atty Wallace.
Court indicates that a Motion had been received and makes additional statements.
Court states that he had just spoken with the defendant and informs Atty Wallace that the defendant would like him to continue to be retained as his counsel.
Atty Wallace makes statements and would request a date for a PTC.
Defendant indicates that he has a sentencing on 1/19/16 in Wood County.
Atty Wallace withdraws his motion to withdraw as counsel for this defendant.
Defendant indicates that he does not currently have an attorney in Wood County.
Court questions Aty Wallace; Atty Wallace makes statements.
Atty Wallace states that he may be the new lawyer in Wood County and will inform the Court.

BY THE COURT:

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 11:00 am.
**Atty Wallace has withdrawn his motion to withdraw as counsel
